result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay appropriate surcharge and pay all applicable Court costs & surcharges by 08-31-15.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs

Defendant Daniel M Webb in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Daniel M Webb in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 94 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.31.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.31.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;

Defendant Daniel M Webb in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Daniel M Webb in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case will remain calendared for trial.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Daniel M Webb not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.29.15 and for jury trial on 7.1.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BAIL
Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing 04/16/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Daniel M Webb in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Daniel M Webb in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:James Klusmann-MPD Officer.   Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF1599 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel M Webb in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Daniel M Webb in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
